text: Augusta Leigh too was favourably impressed, and wrote to Lady Byron after she had received a visit from him: I have today seen Count Gamba- which was very distressing for many reasons but quite unavoidable - he is a pleasing, fine looking young man & spoke with great feeling. The unfortunate Augusta was in one of her worst states of confusion.
handwritten_text: Augusta Leigh too was favourably impressed, and wrote to Lady Byron after she had received a visit from him: I have today seen Count Gamba- which was very distressing for many reasons but quite unavoidable - he is a pleasing, fine looking young man & spoke with great feeling. The unfortunate Augusta was in one of her worst states of confusion.
